title: Instructional Design Strategies to Strengthen Academic Integrity in Online Assessments

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental assessment design principles and familiarity with online learning tools
context.additional_context: Pre-service teachers simulate/VR-practice methods to ensure academic integrity in online science assessments while exploring strategies for post-COVID-19 educational environments

learning_goals: Learners can identify three or more types of academic dishonesty that may occur in online assessments and analyze case examples.
Learners can propose assessment design strategies that maintain academic integrity using VR-based evaluation tools in a simulated environment.
Learners can evaluate vulnerabilities and response strategies in online assessments by applying the "Fraud Triangle Model."
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
